questions.question: What is the primary purpose of financial accounting?
options: To provide information for external stakeholders
questions.answer: To provide information for external stakeholders
questions.explanation: The primary purpose of financial accounting is to provide information for external stakeholders.

questions.question: What is the accounting equation?
questions.explanation: The accounting equation states that Assets equal Liabilities plus Equity.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the statement of cash flows?
options: To provide information about the cash inflows and outflows of a company
To calculate the net income of a company
To report the financial position of a company
questions.answer: To provide information about the cash inflows and outflows of a company
questions.explanation: The purpose of the statement of cash flows is to provide information about the cash inflows and outflows of a company.

questions.question: What is the role of an auditor in the accounting profession?
options: To examine and evaluate financial statements
questions.answer: To examine and evaluate financial statements
questions.explanation: The role of an auditor is to examine and evaluate financial statements.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the balance sheet?
options: To report the financial position of a company at a specific point in time
To calculate the net income of a company
To provide information about cash flows
questions.answer: To report the financial position of a company at a specific point in time
questions.explanation: The purpose of the balance sheet is to report the financial position of a company at a specific point in time.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an intangible asset?
questions.explanation: Patents are an example of an intangible asset.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the income statement?
options: To calculate the net income of a company
To report the financial position of a company at a specific point in time
To provide information about cash flows
questions.answer: To calculate the net income of a company
questions.explanation: The purpose of the income statement is to calculate the net income of a company.

questions.question: What is the role of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) in financial reporting?
options: To regulate and oversee the financial reporting of publicly traded companies
questions.answer: To regulate and oversee the financial reporting of publicly traded companies
questions.explanation: The role of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) is to regulate and oversee the financial reporting of publicly traded companies.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP)?
options: To provide a standard set of guidelines for financial reporting
To calculate the net income of a company
questions.answer: To provide a standard set of guidelines for financial reporting
questions.explanation: The purpose of the Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) is to provide a standard set of guidelines for financial reporting.

questions.question: What is the role of the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) in accounting standards?
options: To establish and improve accounting standards
questions.answer: To establish and improve accounting standards
questions.explanation: The role of the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) is to establish and improve accounting standards.

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a liability?
options: An obligation or debt owed by a company
An item of value owned by a company
Expenses incurred in operating a business
questions.answer: An obligation or debt owed by a company
questions.explanation: A liability is an obligation or debt owed by a company.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the internal control system in accounting?
options: To safeguard assets and ensure accurate financial reporting
questions.answer: To safeguard assets and ensure accurate financial reporting
questions.explanation: The purpose of the internal control system in accounting is to safeguard assets and ensure accurate financial reporting.

questions.question: Which accounting method records revenue when it is earned and expenses when they are incurred?
questions.explanation: Accrual accounting records revenue when it is earned and expenses when they are incurred.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the cost principle in accounting?
options: To record assets at their original cost
To calculate the net income of a company
questions.answer: To record assets at their original cost
questions.explanation: The purpose of the cost principle in accounting is to record assets at their original cost.
